title.narrative: CDF 1: Annual Performance Review (APR) Process strengthens the capacity of MOE officers to systemically and transparently report on budget outputs and targets achievements over the last 12 months

description.narrative: % average Department Performance Assessment Framework (PAF) overall score across 11 Departments following each Annual Budget and Outputs Evaluation exercise under the APR Process

description.narrative: % average Department Performance Assessment Framework (PAF) overall score across 11 Departments following each Annual Budget and Outputs Evaluation exercise under the APR Process

title.narrative: CDF 5: MOE officers complete leadership and management training courses and apply newly acquired knowledge and skills in their day-to-day work environments.

description.narrative:
% of leadership and management training course graduates who can provide concrete examples of how they have applied newly acquired knowledge and skills in their day-to-day work environments
% of Diploma in Education Management graduates surveyed after 4 months report examples of application of newly acquired knowledge and skills in their day-to-day work environments

title.narrative: CDF 5: MOE officers complete leadership and management training courses and apply newly acquired knowledge and skills in their day-to-day work environments.

description.narrative:
% of leadership and management training course graduates who can provide concrete examples of how they have applied newly acquired knowledge and skills in their day-to-day work environments
% of Diploma in Education Management graduates surveyed after 4 months report examples of application of newly acquired knowledge and skills in their day-to-day work environments

comment.narrative:
150 MOE officers attend Seminar and Certificate courses in leadership and management.
50 MoE officials participated in the Diploma in Education Management Course.

title.narrative: CDF 4: PTA Executive Committee (EC) School Improvement Programme implemented in trained schools improves the involvement of parents in activities organised by their PTA leading to improvements in the quality of education in their school.

description.narrative: % of parents in trained schools involved in monthly school quality improvement activities organised by their PTA

title.narrative: CDF 4: PTA Executive Committee (EC) School Improvement Programme implemented in trained schools improves the involvement of parents in activities organised by their PTA leading to improvements in the quality of education in their school.

description.narrative: % of parents in trained schools involved in monthly school quality improvement activities organised by their PTA

comment.narrative: PTA EC School Improvement Programme not yet in place

title.narrative: CDF 2: SSWG Chairs and members participate in Annual Budget Review (ABR) Workshops and make budget expenditure recommendations for the MoE and Departments to consider in their annual budget submissions to MoPF to support NESP implementation

description.narrative: % of recommendations made at the ABR workshops that are included in budget submission to MoPF

title.narrative: CDF 2: SSWG Chairs and members participate in Annual Budget Review (ABR) Workshops and make budget expenditure recommendations for the MoE and Departments to consider in their annual budget submissions to MoPF to support NESP implementation

description.narrative: % of recommendations made at the ABR workshops that are included in budget submission to MoPF

comment.narrative: 0% -- No ABR Workshop/system in place for SSWG members to make budget recommendations to MOE and Departments to consider in their annual budget submission to MoPF

title.narrative: CDF 3: Communication for Education Management (C4M) launched in trained basic education schools and townships improves the efficiency of administrative and strengthens accountability between schools, township, state/region and HQ offices.

description.narrative: % of trained schools that are actively using the C4M App reporting a reduction in the time taken for decisions to be made by Township education officers on administrative requests made by head teachers

title.narrative: CDF 3: Communication for Education Management (C4M) launched in trained basic education schools and townships improves the efficiency of administrative and strengthens accountability between schools, township, state/region and HQ offices.

description.narrative: % of trained schools that are actively using the C4M App reporting a reduction in the time taken for decisions to be made by Township education officers on administrative requests made by head teachers

comment.narrative: 0% -- No ICT-based, electronic system in place to improve the efficiency of administrative requests made by head teachers to townships and strengthen accountability

title.narrative: Ministry officers use newly acquired leadership and management knowledge and skills and new management systems to support implementation of the National Education Strategic Plan (NESP) 2016-2021 and improve front-line education service delivery

description.narrative: No. of new management systems operational for more than 18 months to support evidence-based decision-making

title.narrative: Ministry officers use newly acquired leadership and management knowledge and skills and new management systems to support implementation of the National Education Strategic Plan (NESP) 2016-2021 and improve front-line education service delivery

description.narrative: No. of new management systems operational for more than 18 months to support evidence-based decision-making

comment.narrative: Sector-wide, Department and cross-Department management systems not in place to support NESP implementation.
